New Records: Florian Wirtz became Germany's youngest scorer in European Championship history.
Key Match Events: Germany scored three goals in the first half.
Ryan Porteous was sent off on the stroke of half-time.
Niclas Füllkrug and Emre Can added two more goals late in the second half.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal for Scotland.
Pre-Game Insights: Julian Nagelsmann's Germany started their Euro 2024 campaign.
Post-Match Reflections: Ílkay Gündogan said, 'We played with a lot of intensity and played the right spaces, took some risks, and that is why we scored.'
Steve Clarke, the Scotland coach, said, 'First half, we just got it all wrong really, didn't show up, weren't aggressive enough, and we let good players get on the ball.'
Andy Robertson, Scotland captain, said, 'Second half, we're down to 10 men and I thought the lads dug in really well. We have to bounce back quickly because there was lots wrong here.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Germans dominated possession from the start.
Scotland's strategy of defending high proved fatal.
Others: The match took place at the Allianz Arena in München, Germany.
The match was covered by FOX.
The referee for the match was Clément Turpin.
